nodes.label: Execution of Thjazi Fang
nodes.description: The public execution of Thjazi Fang by hanging, ordered by the Chamber of Lords-Advisory. A failed escape plan was attempted during the event.
outcomes: Thjazi Fang is killed.
Thjazi panics at seeing something in the sky.
Thjazi gives Hal a cryptic message about Murray, the Penteveral, Bolaire, and Thimble.
The escape plan fails.

nodes.label: Wake (Farramh) for Thjazi Fang
nodes.description: An orcish wake (farramh) held at Halandil's home following Thjazi's execution. It serves as a meeting point for all major characters.
outcomes: Characters meet, mourn, and reveal relationships.
Azune, Teor, and Occtis leave to investigate the flophouse.
Julien spits on Thjazi's corpse.
Vaelus arrives demanding the Stone of Nightsong.
The mysterious mask box is activated.

nodes.label: Flophouse Investigation
nodes.description: Azune, Teor, and Occtis investigate Thjazi's hidden flophouse to find Thimble and learn why the escape plan failed.
outcomes: The room is found ransacked with signs of a battle and blood.
The dying Thimble is discovered hidden in a grate.

nodes.label: Thimble's Revival
nodes.description: Teor revives the dying Thimble, who confirms the escape plan and her attack. Kattigan Vale arrives, having followed the group.
outcomes: Teor heals Thimble with Cure Wounds.
Thimble is devastated to learn of Thjazi's death.
It's confirmed the glyph on Thjazi was a fake.
Kattigan Vale joins the group.
Thimble finds a letter addressed to Bolaire.

nodes.label: Attack on Thimble (Flashback)
nodes.description: An attack on Thimble at the flophouse *before* the execution, preventing her from delivering the escape glyph.
outcomes: Thimble was attacked by 7 masked figures (3 were killed).
The Stone of Nightsong was stolen.
Thimble was left for dead, hiding in the grate with the real glyph.

nodes.label: Kattigan's Investigation
nodes.description: Kattigan uses his 'Clue' spell to reconstruct the fight at the flophouse.
outcomes: Identified 7 attackers, 3 died.
Found crow feathers, implicating the Crow Keepers guild.
Noted one attacker wore fine boots.
Confirmed magical items, including the Stone of Nightsong, were stolen.

nodes.label: Julien Spits on Corpse
nodes.description: While alone with the body, Sir Julien Davinos expresses his hatred for Thjazi and spits on his corpse.
outcomes: Julien's true feelings are revealed to the audience.

nodes.label: Bolaire Sees Shadow
nodes.description: After Julien spits on the corpse (crossing funeral protections), Bolaire rolls a Natural 20 and perceives a shadow detach and follow Julien.
outcomes: Bolaire becomes aware of a magical effect targeting Julien.

nodes.label: Vaelus Arrives
nodes.description: Vaelus, an elf from the Sisters of Sylandri, interrupts the wake.
outcomes: Vaelus accuses Thjazi of being a thief and demands the return of the Stone of Nightsong.
Bolaire confirms knowledge of the stone's religious significance.
Vaelus asks for Thimble.

nodes.label: Mask Box Activation
nodes.description: As Thimble's name is spoken downstairs by Vaelus, a silver box held by Thaisha upstairs flies open, and shattered black ceramic inside assembles itself into a mask.
outcomes: The box is revealed to contain a magical mask.
The episode ends on this cliffhanger.

nodes.label: Halandil 'Hal' Fang
nodes.description: An older orc, poet and performer. Brother of the deceased Thjazi Fang. He lives in The Rookery and is hosting the wake.
nodes.relationships: Brother of Thjazi Fang; Former partner of Thaisha Lloy; Father of Shadia and Hero; Business partner of Olgud Akarat.

nodes.label: Azune Nayar
nodes.description: A human-appearing Arcane Marshal of the Revolutionary Guard. He is tall, proud, and heavily armored. He served in the Falconer's Rebellion with Thjazi.
nodes.relationships: Comrade of Thjazi, Teor, and Kattigan from the Falconer's Rebellion.
nodes.abilities: Detect Magic (ritual and spell), Message (cantrip), False Life.

nodes.label: Thaisha Lloy
nodes.description: A tall orc druid from the Lloy family. She shows signs of aging but is slowed by her druidic connection. She was part of the failed plan to save Thjazi.
nodes.relationships: Former partner of Hal; Mother of Shadia and Alogar; Knew Thjazi.
nodes.abilities: Enrichment (spell), Druidcraft, Wild Shape (into Hala, a deer), Guidance.

nodes.label: Occtis Tachonis
nodes.description: A small, young human man in worn noble clothing. He is a member of House Tachonis and was part of the failed escape plan.
nodes.relationships: Member of House Tachonis; Works with Thaisha.
nodes.abilities: Has a fox familiar named Pincushion 'Pin', Disguise Self.

nodes.label: Teor Pridesire
nodes.description: A tall, powerfully-built lion man (nama). He is a Vanguard Marshal and served in the Falconer's Rebellion. He is looking for his brother, Cyd.
nodes.relationships: Served with Thjazi, Azune, and Loza Blade; Brother of Talcydimir 'Cyd' Pridesire.

nodes.label: Wicander 'Wick' Halovar
nodes.description: A beautiful young man, Light Priest of the Candescent Creed. He is from House Halovar and was involved in a failed political attempt to pardon Thjazi.
nodes.relationships: Grandson of Photarch Yanessa Halovar; Son of Godard; Mentors Tyranny.
nodes.abilities: Thaumaturgy, knowledge of Candescent Creed hymns.

nodes.label: Aspirant Tyranny
nodes.description: A bubblegum-skinned demon with goat features (hooves, horns, eyes). She is an Aspirant to the Candescent Creed, assigned to Wicander.
nodes.relationships: Aspirant to Wicander; Sibling named Enmity.
nodes.abilities: Demonic constitution (drank a bottle of Yahrgraz), throwing (hurled scimitar).

nodes.label: Bolaire Lathalia
nodes.description: A dashing figure in fine clothes who wears a moving, sighing gray clay mask with empty black eyes. He deals with nobility and knew of Thjazi.
nodes.relationships: Knew Thjazi (dealings); Acquaintance of Vaelus (let her into the city); Mentioned in Thjazi's final words.
nodes.abilities: Arcane/Religious knowledge (Nat 20), perception of magical effects.

nodes.label: Sir Julien Davinos
nodes.description: A human knight from House Davinos, vassal to House Royce. He has a stern, stoic look and wears an intricate metal gauntlet on his left hand. He bears a deep hatred for Thjazi.
nodes.relationships: Childhood friend and protector of Lady Aranessa; Captured Thjazi during his rebellion; Son of General Raimond Davinos.

nodes.label: Murray Mag'Nesson
nodes.description: A dwarf woman with long auburn hair, a duster jacket, and gemstone teeth. She is an arcanist and knows many of the magical underbelly at the funeral.
nodes.relationships: Works at the Penteveral; Acquaintance of Bolaire; Knew Thjazi; Mentioned in Thjazi's final words.

nodes.label: Kattigan Vale
nodes.description: A human ranger in his mid-40s, described as a 'wild man'. He is often drunk but highly capable. He served in the Falconer's Rebellion.
nodes.relationships: Comrade of Teor and Azune; Knew Thjazi and Thimble; Has a wolf companion, Wulfric.

nodes.label: Thimble
nodes.description: A 4-inch tall pixie, Thjazi's partner in crime and adventure. She was attacked and left for dead while preparing Thjazi's escape.
nodes.relationships: Thjazi's close partner; Knew Teor, Azune, Kattigan.

nodes.label: Vaelus
nodes.description: A very tall elven woman in black armor and a chainmail veil of mourning. She is from the Sisters of Sylandri and has traveled far.
nodes.relationships: Member of the Sisters of Sylandri; Acquaintance of Bolaire.
nodes.abilities: Swings a censer as a weapon, ancient (forgotten what grieving is like).

nodes.label: Thjazi Fang
nodes.description: An orc arcanist and 'hero' of the Falconer's Rebellion. Executed for murder, theft, and sedition. He is the central figure of the wake.
nodes.relationships: Brother of Hal; Estranged husband of Aranessa Royce; Partner of Thimble; Comrade of Azune, Teor, Kattigan, Loza.

nodes.label: Shadia Fang
nodes.description: Young orcish woman, daughter of Hal and Thaisha. Grieving her uncle Thjazi.
nodes.relationships: Daughter of Hal and Thaisha; Niece of Thjazi.

nodes.label: Olgud Akarat
nodes.description: Older orcish gentleman, Hal's business partner.
nodes.relationships: Business partner and friend of Hal; 'Uncle' to Shadia.

nodes.label: Loza Blade
nodes.description: Ancient, broad-shouldered orcish woman with a battle axe. Former Commander of the Torn Banner. She is retiring.
nodes.relationships: Former commander of Teor, Thjazi; Friend of Hal.
nodes.abilities: Veteran warrior, knowledge of Old Path.

nodes.label: Pincushion 'Pin'
nodes.description: A small fox familiar made of pieces of other foxes with purple button eyes.
nodes.relationships: Familiar to Occtis; Friends with Wulfric.

nodes.label: Lady Aranessa Royce
nodes.description: A noblewoman from House Royce, Thjazi's estranged widow. She is grieving and furious at House Halovar.
nodes.relationships: Estranged widow of Thjazi; Childhood friend of Julien; Noble of House Royce.

nodes.label: Hero
nodes.description: A young half-orc girl, daughter of Hal and Elodie.
nodes.relationships: Daughter of Hal and Elodie; Half-sister of Shadia.

nodes.label: Elodie
nodes.description: A human merchant woman, mother of Hero.
nodes.relationships: Mother of Hero; Partner of Hal.

nodes.label: Wulfric
nodes.description: A massive juvenile canine (wolf) companion to Kattigan.
nodes.relationships: Companion to Kattigan; Friends with Pin.

nodes.label: Aspirant Enmity
nodes.description: A demon with ram-like horns, sibling to Tyranny, and another Aspirant of the Candescent Creed.
nodes.relationships: Sibling of Tyranny.

nodes.label: Photarch Yanessa Halovar
nodes.description: The matriarch of House Halovar and leader of the Candescent Creed. She gave the speech at the execution and ultimately allowed it to proceed.
nodes.relationships: Grandmother of Wicander; Mother of Godard.

nodes.label: Casimir Gavendale
nodes.description: An old member of the Torn Banner. He was supposed to provide the escape wagon for Thjazi.
nodes.relationships: Former member of Torn Banner.

nodes.label: Talcydimir 'Cyd' Pridesire
nodes.description: Teor's younger brother. He was supposed to drive the escape wagon for Thjazi and is currently missing.
nodes.relationships: Brother of Teor; Former member of Torn Banner.

nodes.label: Tunk
nodes.description: A beastfolk warrior with a boar's head, formerly of the Torn Banner.
nodes.relationships: Attended wake; Former Torn Banner.

nodes.label: Tashmara Cobblegrave
nodes.description: An arcanist present at Thjazi's funeral.
nodes.relationships: Acquaintance of Murray.

nodes.label: Uncle Emerald
nodes.description: A tiny gnome arcanist at Thjazi's funeral.
nodes.relationships: Acquaintance of Murray.

nodes.label: Davrasi Gaunt
nodes.description: A sallow-faced arcanist at Thjazi's funeral, looking to acquire skulls.
nodes.relationships: Acquaintance of Murray.

nodes.label: Dol-Makjar
nodes.description: A city of gray stone at the eastern edge of Kahad, built on mountainsides along the River Vrosh. It is the seat of the revolution against the gods.
nodes.features: Guardian Wall, towering spires, Revolutionary Council.

nodes.label: Guardian Wall
nodes.description: A massive wall at the eastern edge of Dol-Makjar, carved with 80-foot-tall statues of heroes from the Shapers' War.
nodes.features: Statues of orcs, dwarves, elves, humans, etc. Site of Thjazi's execution.

nodes.label: The Rookery
nodes.description: A neighborhood in Dol-Makjar named for its aviaries. A vertical area of towers and sky bridges, home to poets, performers, and artists.

nodes.label: Halandil's Home
nodes.description: A modest, medium-sized house in The Rookery, with views of the river. Has a large greeting room for gatherings and an upstairs study filled with scrolls and instruments.

nodes.label: The Tanners
nodes.description: A grimy, working-class neighborhood in the south of Dol-Makjar, named for its tanneries.
nodes.features: Smell of curing leather, Ograhmson Leather Tannery.

nodes.label: Thjazi's Flophouse
nodes.description: A secret apartment hidden within the Ograhmson Leather Tannery in The Tanners. Used by Thjazi as an illegal arcanist's hideout.
nodes.features: Hidden door (activated by 'S' in sign), secret staircase, ransacked room, floor grate.

nodes.label: The Mournvale
nodes.description: A location Vaelus traveled from. Thjazi and Thimble also adventured there.

nodes.label: The Penteveral
nodes.description: An institution of magical learning where Murray Mag'Nesson works.

nodes.label: Revolutionary Guard
nodes.description: The official guard force of Dol-Makjar.

nodes.label: Sundered Houses
nodes.description: A coalition of noble houses (Tachonis, Halovar, Royce, Einfasen, Cormoray) that form the Chamber of Lords-Advisory. They ordered Thjazi's execution and are gaining power.

nodes.label: Candescent Creed
nodes.description: A new religious faith adopted by House Halovar, centered on 'The Light'.

nodes.label: The Old Path
nodes.description: An ancient orcish custom or faith, mentioned by Olgud and Loza. Involves funeral rites.

nodes.label: Falconer's Rebellion
nodes.description: A past war or rebellion. Thjazi was a hero of this conflict.

nodes.label: Torn Banner
nodes.description: A mercenary company that fought in the Falconer's Rebellion, commanded by Loza Blade.

nodes.label: Crow Keepers
nodes.description: One of the oldest thieves' guilds in Dol-Makjar. Implicated in the attack on Thimble.

nodes.label: Sisters of Sylandri
nodes.description: An elven religious order dedicated to the fallen goddess of life, Sylandri.

nodes.label: Thimble's Escape Glyph
nodes.description: A small ceramic rune with conjuration and illusion magic, created by Thimble to teleport Thjazi.
nodes.status: In Azune's possession, recovered from the flophouse.

nodes.label: Fake Escape Glyph
nodes.description: An unknown item planted on Thjazi that mimicked the magic signature (conjuration/illusion) of the real glyph, fooling Azune's scan.
nodes.status: On Thjazi's body (now at Hal's home).

nodes.label: Stone of Nightsong
nodes.description: A stone artifact, described as a bird (nightingale) embracing itself. It's a relic of the fallen goddess Sylandri, meant to ferry elven souls past the underworld.
nodes.origin: Created by a celestial of Sylandri after the Shapers' War.
nodes.status: Stolen from Thimble's flophouse by the Crow Keepers.

nodes.label: Letter to Bolaire
nodes.description: A letter Thimble found in the wreckage of the flophouse, addressed to Bolaire.

nodes.label: Thjazi's Scimitar
nodes.description: Thjazi's personal weapon. It was confiscated and given to Wicander, who returned it to Hal.
nodes.status: In Hal's possession, placed on the deed in his study.

nodes.label: Deed to Dithyramb of Azgra
nodes.description: A deed of title for an ancient public space, granted to Hal for his theater.

nodes.label: Silver Box / Assembling Mask
nodes.description: A silver box Thaisha brought to the wake. When Thimble's name was spoken, it opened to reveal shattered black ceramic fragments that began assembling into a mask.
